chats.title: What is RAG?
chats.lastMessage: RAG stands for Retrieval-Augmented Generation, a technique that combines the power of large language models with external knowledge retrieval to provide more accurate and up-to-date responses.

chats.title: Machine Learning Basics
chats.lastMessage: Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence that focuses on algorithms that can learn and make decisions from data without being explicitly programmed.

chats.title: Neural Networks Explained
chats.lastMessage: Neural networks are computing systems inspired by biological neural networks. They consist of interconnected nodes (neurons) that process information using a connectionist approach.

chats.title: AI Ethics Discussion
chats.lastMessage: Ethical considerations in AI development are crucial for ensuring responsible deployment. This includes fairness, transparency, privacy, and accountability.

chats.title: Natural Language Processing
chats.lastMessage: NLP is a field of AI that focuses on the interaction between computers and humans through natural language. It involves processing and analyzing large amounts of natural language data.

chats.title: Deep Learning Fundamentals
chats.lastMessage: Deep learning is a subset of machine learning that uses neural networks with multiple layers to model and understand complex patterns in data.

chats.title: Computer Vision Applications
chats.lastMessage: Computer vision enables machines to interpret and understand visual information from the world, with applications in image recognition, object detection, and medical imaging.

chats.title: Reinforcement Learning
chats.lastMessage: Reinforcement learning is a type of machine learning where an agent learns to make decisions by taking actions in an environment to maximize cumulative reward.
